text: W. Carter Merbreier (August 2, 1926 â€“ August 9, 2016) was an American television personality. He was ordained Lutheran minister and former police chaplain for the Philadelphia Police Department. Merbreier created and co- hosted the long-running syndicated children's television series Captain Noah and His Magical Ark from 1967 to 1994. Merbreier was born on August 2, 1926 in Prospect Park, Pennsylvania and died on August 9, 2016 in Audubon, Pennsylvania at the age of 90. == References == Category:1926 births Category:2016 deaths Category:American television personalities Category:American Lutherans Category:Christian religious leaders Category:People from Pennsylvania
